alert.note: Alert for Iroquois (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 18 at 5:47AM CST until February 19 at 7:12AM CST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Indiana... Sugar Creek at Milford affecting Iroquois County. Iroquois River at Iroquois affecting Newton and Iroquois Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sugar Creek at Milford. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Structures threatened in southwest Milford. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 19.1 feet and cresting. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CST Friday was 19.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to very gradually fall today and tonight. It will fall below flood stage late tonight. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected around 1145 PM CST this evening.
